title: UK Regulator Saw 'Poor' Engagement From Some Overseas Crypto Firms on Upcoming Ad Rules
description: With the rules set to take effect Oct. 8, officials at the Financial Conduct Authority have a plan to tackle non-compliant firms, CoinDesk was told.

title: The Impact of AI Girlfriends on American Society: Experts Clash Over Concerns
description: In a world increasingly influenced by technology, the rise of artificial intelligence (AI) has begun to reshape even the most personal aspects of our lives. title: NSA Launches Artificial Intelligence Security Center to Safeguard Government Algorithms
description: The National Security Agency (NSA) has recently announced the establishment of a dedicated Artificial Intelligence Security Center to secure the government’s increasing use of algorithms and AI systems. This development comes in response to the rising reliance on AI in defense and intelligence applications, and the center’s primary mission is to safeguard these systems against ... Read more

title: Ripple’s XRP: Riding High with Supreme Court’s Game-Changing Move
description: Ripple’s Chief Legal Officer, Stuart Alderoty, shared banners on social media suggesting the US Supreme Court’s intention to curb the power of federal agencies. XRP’s price action currently places it above the 200-day EMA while below the 50-day EMA, signaling mixed short-term and long-term prospects. Ripple’s native cryptocurrency XRP is making strong moves gaining 4.40 [...]

title: AI Could Face Same Scrutiny as Bitcoin Mining, Experts Warn
description:
Artificial intelligence (AI) chips have come under scrutiny from energy and tech experts for their significant electricity consumption. Energy entrepreneur Brian Gitt recently took to X (formerly Twitter) to report the rising energy consumption by AI chips. According to Gitt, a single Nvidia graphics processing unit (GPU) consumes approximately the same amount of energy as […]

The post AI Could Face Same Scrutiny as Bitcoin Mining, Experts Warn appeared first on Coin Edition.
